posts.post_content:
Have you seen the Worldwake preview caeds yet? Man-lands, land-animation auras that return the land they enchant to their owner's hand if the land goes into the graveyard, and an enchantment that makes every land you control indestuctable.
  
[Dryad Arbor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dryad Arbor), Kamigawa's Genju and [Awakener Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Awakener Druid) also go well with this card.
posts.html:
Have you seen the Worldwake preview caeds yet? Man-lands, land-animation auras that return the land they enchant to their owner's hand if the land goes into the graveyard, and an enchantment that makes every land you control indestuctable.
Dryad Arbor, Kamigawa's Genju and Awakener Druid also go well with this card.

posts.post_content:
Land animation sets you up for an [Armageddon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armageddon) when you opponent plays [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) or [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God). Don't bother with this crap rare.  
  
It does nothing on its own, and it's a hefty four mana, and since most land-animating cards hit your opponents' lands too, this sucks pretty badly.
posts.html:

It does nothing on its own, and it's a hefty four mana, and since most land-animating cards hit your opponents' lands too, this sucks pretty badly.
